demcrit 1.0.0
  • Reference
    • Accessing Concordance Statistics
    • Impact of Correlation on Concordance

Validation of Algorithms for PDD

This package is not intended for a widespread public use. The idea is to:

  1. provide a documentation behind data analysis that serves as a backbone of the empirical part of the paper Mana et al. (under review), and

  2. provide a set of functions used to generate our results that could be directly used or slightly adjusted for projects aiming at similar goals.

To start, install a local instance of the package:

# If you do not have the devtools package,
# install it by uncommenting the following line:
#install.packages(devtools)
devtools::install_github("josefmana/demcrit")

There are two ways to use the package (both of which will receive their own vignette in the near future):

  1. If you have the raw data at your disposal, make sure they are present in the data-raw folder and run the targets pipeline which is part of the package (this option is only possible from the First Faculty of Medicine, Charles University computers because of privacy concerns of patients’ data; it also requires the apaquarto extension (version 4.4.1) to be installed in the _manuscript folder)

  2. If you do not have the raw data, you can still use some of the functions on your own, similarly structured data set. A vignette showing reproducible example of such a use will be added in the next version of this package.
